title.narrative: 1.15 STIMULATING DEMAND FOR Child Survival and Development (CSD)

description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Protective and learning environment Programme Component Results (PCR) 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for mostdisadvantaged children.

description.narrative: Departments of Health and Family Welfare in 11 states, Women and Child Development in 4 states, Rural Development and Information and Cultural Affairs in 7 states and district-level Social and Behaviour Change institutions in 5 states strengthened through functional behaviour change communication cells in government departments. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: No. of communication partnerships mobilized for preventing neonatal deaths, childhood illnesses, maternal and child undernutrition (with a focus on stunting) and elimination of open defecation

target.value: 2016:Communication partnership forums active in 9 States and at national level

title.narrative: No of published analysis on effectiveness of SBCC strategies/methods/innovations impacting positively on child survival, growth and development available.

baseline.value: 1 literature review on SBC for Child Survival

target.value: 2016:One multi-State document/assessment study on innovation in RI demand generation available and disseminated

title.narrative: Number of states with comm. units in key govt dept. that can {The criteria to assess cap. thru the following dimensions:1)shared understanding of SBCC, the inst. & soc. context in which the prog operates, & its priorities, 2)shared recognition of gaps & cap. building, 3)established procedures, convergent planning&impl. 4)no. of functional & evidence-based comm. strategies aligned with natl. flagship progs,5) Assessment, sharing& mangt of results}design, implement, monitor &evalu SBCC strategies.

No. of quality communication frameworks /strategies for preventing neonatal deaths, childhood illnesses, maternal and child undernutrition (focus on stunting) and elimination of open defecation, developed with government and partners at national / state level and linked to relevant PIPs

title.narrative: Proportion of national and state level government training institutions/non - government organizations with the capacity to conduct SBCC trainings, with a special focus on social inclusion.

target.value: 2016:State Training Institutions in 9 States complete SBCC state level master trainers and district level master trainers training for RI demand generation SBCC
